text: russian officials say ukrainian
helicopters have carried out a strike on
a fuel storage facility in the west of
russia emergency services say 170
personnel are trying to put out the
flames in belgorod ukraine hasn't
commented but ukrainian aircraft haven't
previously struck targets in russia the
kremlin says the attack will hinder
peace talks with kiev
well i'm joined now by jenny hill in
moscow jenny how much have we got that's
verified about this incident
we can't verify it at this stage we have
this morning the governor of the region
of belgarrod saying that as far as he's
concerned two ukrainian military
helicopters crossed the border overnight
and carried out airstrikes on that fuel
depot um interestingly the kremlin
hasn't really confirmed as such the
suspicion that this was a ukrainian
airstrike but as you say dmitry peskov
the spokesman has said the situation um
will not make for create comfortable
circumstances for the um the ongoing
peace talks they've resumed of course
this afternoon in an online
format so no official confirmation but
this is as you say the very first time
since the invasion began that russia has
reported a ukrainian attack on its
territory and what i think is
interesting is that the russian response
thus far has actually been really rather
muted surprisingly so um given that this
country the kremlin um usually seizes on
any opportunity to portray ukraine as an
aggressor so we've heard from the
governor of the neighbouring region
which also borders ukraine he said
earlier that he would put his security
forces on um a heightened state of alert
but beyond that all we've really had
from the kremlin is this
warning that you know this this could
jeopardize peace talks but actually you
know even the language there is is still
rather rather passive um having said
that of course you know it's not going
to do um any good in terms of trying to
dampen down tensions between the two
countries as those negotiations continue
uh this afternoon yes and jenny the the
words they're saying that it's it's not
it doesn't make for a comfortable
backdrop for negotiations
is there any indication of what this
might mean as you say it's still rather
muted language
yeah and i think you know it doesn't
help put it that way um but it's
interesting that um the russians
haven't really gone health or leather
some of the language that we have seen
here in recent weeks even recent days
since the negotiations broke up earlier
this week
has been so belligerent
moscow regularly accuses ukraine of with
the help of america preparing biological
weapons to use against russia this is a
narrative that runs even in you know
state newspapers yesterday and some even
this morning i saw you know still
carrying this as a line so it is
interesting that the language has been
muted now i wouldn't draw the conclusion
from that that the russians are thinking
let's let's keep our response down for
now so that the negotiations can
continue you know amidst a more peaceful
atmosphere this afternoon i think it's
more likely they're still trying to
establish exactly what has happened
because of course we still don't have
the verification that this was a
ukrainian attack before they perhaps
decide on their response there is also a
school of thought that having boasted
that the russians have achieved air
superiority over ukraine
if it's proven that this was a
successful attack on russian territory
by ukrainian military helicopters
that might prove to be rather a
humiliating development for the russians
that might be you know another argument
behind the rather muted response thus
far speculation on my part and we'll
have to wait and see if the kremlin
makes any further comments
